Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2013 03:53PM InTheWind wrote: Lily I don't understand I thought it was a law that insurance companys had to pay for reconstruction? What company are you with?  Heck I'll start a massive campaign against them!
Posts.Title: Stage and grade of cancer determined AFTER surgery. What!?! InTheWind InTheWind

Posts.Content: InTheWind wrote: "You won't know the stage and grade of cancer until AFTER surgery." What!?! I did the biopsy last week and they found cancer in both breast. My MRI is not scheduled until this friday, so basically all I know it the type of cancer.  The nurse that called and gave me the results had me write it down and said I should google it.  So I did. In the search I found information on skin sparring mastectomies and nipple sparring mastectomies. So I emailed the surgeon who I will be meeting after the MRI and asked him if they do that at Kiaser.  I got a call back from the nurse who gave me the biopsy results and she told me they don't do that because it's cosmetic and they are more concerned with saving lifes.  She commended me for my  research :/  She also told me I would not know the stage and grade of the cancer until AFTER the surgery! I flipped! How the heck do I know what type of surgery I want if I don't even know how "bad" this cancer is? So I asked around, and everyone I have talked to who has had cancer told me they knew BEFORE the surgery. Is this just the response of a new nurse or is it Kiaser?  If the doctor tells me the same thing I'm thinking I better find a new insurance plan before I let anyone cut me up.  I understand I jumped the gun asking about nipple sparring surgery as I don't know if it is to close to my nipple, but for cosmetics to not even be considered scares the crap out of me. Last time I checked I was a complete person. Being ALIVE yes in number one, second is what damage will be done to the look and feel of my body. Am I going to look like a freak show with Frankenstein boobs and still have to go through chemo and look like I am from a pink floyed video?  Or should I get the lumps removed and just deal with looking like Pink Floyd. Why the heck can't cosmetics be a consideration also? I breath, think and feel - seems all those factors are important! I don't know where this cancer stands yet. So I don't know even what options are best for me.  And YES my LIFE is first, second is my abilty to care for my kids and work (which is why I would like to avoid chemo - I'm a big baby when I have a cold let alone feeling tired when I have a job that requires me to be awake and alert) - and third my boobs are important! THis might be too much information but Brandon can give me an orgasm just by what he does to my breast.  Yes, I admit it, I love my sexual relation with him. Losing that is a BIG bummer!  But I get it, I will lose that sensation, ok, but do I have to look like Frankenstein in the process?  I need to stop googling breast reconstruction photos because it is giving me nightmares!  I'm leaning toward having both breast removed and with any luck avoiding chemo.  But If I have to do chemo anyway maybe I can spare my boobs and my sex life. But how do I know if I don't know the stage and grade? And what was the biopsy for if they couldn't tell that information from what they already took out of me? Why do they have to cut it all out to know? Dx 1/4/2013, ILC, Both breasts, 3cm, Stage IIA, Grade 1, 0/2 nodes, ER+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Stage and grade of cancer determined AFTER surgery. What!?! InTheWind InTheWind

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2013 11:54AM InTheWind wrote: It pays to question everything and have more tests run. I just got this email from my oncologist regarding the PET Scan: "Dear Michelle, So glad to repot that pet/ct scan did not detect any disease outside beast. I will ask my clinical coordinator to help sch an appt with me 2 weeks after your surgery It was nice to meet you, Lala Cornelius, MD" Thank GOD!!! It looks like it might be easier to get through.  One thing about them throwing thier extreme wants in my face now I feel so relieved I don't have to go the extreme that I'm not even upset about having cancer anymore :)
Posts.Title: Stage and grade of cancer determined AFTER surgery. What!?! InTheWind InTheWind

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2013 03:54PM InTheWind wrote: And your doctors name and location as well! As far as what I have heard WE have the choice to remove both not the doctors or insurance companys
Posts.Title: Stage and grade of cancer determined AFTER surgery. What!?! InTheWind InTheWind

Posts.Content: Jan 25, 2013 06:39AM InTheWind wrote: I hope everyone is doing well and that treatment is a speady process for you.  If you're like me you just want to get it over with and get to the other side.  Living an hour and a half away from the doctors office and such frequent visits to see them is going to break the bank.
Posts.Title: Stage and grade of cancer determined AFTER surgery. What!?! InTheWind InTheWind

Posts.Content: Jan 9, 2013 12:48PM - edited Jan 9, 2013 12:51PM by InTheWind I agree with you AlwaysHope! It's really upsetting me, like I'm a piece of meat they want to keep alive and what I feel or think doesn't matter. And I'm sitting here thinking wait a minute! I already know I am going to live, so why the heck can't I consider the other effects it has on my life!  I emailed the doctor but it was the nurse who replied.  I hope to God the doctor isn't that way. I applied for medical assistance today because if I have to I will switch care facilities. I could only get Kiaser insurance from my work. So if all else fails at least I can see someone else. Even if they tell me no after looking at my situation at least it's considered. My neihbor had the nipple sparring surgery and she has been cancer free for a year now.
Posts.Title: Stage and grade of cancer determined AFTER surgery. What!?! InTheWind InTheWind

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2013 01:01PM InTheWind wrote: I know bluepearl and I don't mean to hurt anyones feelings and some, in fact most women, have good results. However I did the whole google of breast reconstruction images and it looked like a night mare with scares and patches and nippleless features like frankenstein.  That on top of no hair or eyebrows or eyelashes and dealing with not just a flat cheast because they didn't want me to have reconstruction right away and the scars on my flat chest was too much of a nightmare for me to handle.  If I knew I would die otherwise I would go through it and have a better attitude about the way I looked but just to do it not even knowing if it was neccessary in my case was not something I could handle. Yes I am a woman, yes I care about my appearence and no I don't think my looks define me as a person and no I am not all that pretty, I'm just me.  And every part of the outside of me was about to change and it freaked me out.  And despite Brandon telling me I'm beautiful and it doesn't matter if I don't have breast or hair or even estrogen to keep up my sex drive he would still love and would still think I'm beautful - it would affect me still.  It's not just about life it is about the quality of life for me and my sexual relationship with Brandon is a major part of my inner joy.  It's hard to explain. Of course I don't want to hurt anyone or say something to hurt someone who is going through this but I would be a lier if I said I wouldn't feel completly horrible and feel horrible about my appearance. Would it stop me from living NO but it would make me very sad and even more insecure then I occasionally get.  You will hear a lot from the newbiees going through this such as feeling like a freek or frankenstein and yadda yadda yadda, please be understanding and KNOW they don't want to hurt anyone they just have to express how they currently feel at the level of their treatment. They in most part will hide alot from their loved ones but to the women hear going through what they are going through I hope they always feel free to express their true feelings because only then can they get through it to the other side of feeling like a freak into feeling bald is beautiful and chestless is still sexy.
Posts.Title: Stage and grade of cancer determined AFTER surgery. What!?! InTheWind InTheWind

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2013 01:30PM - edited Jan 17, 2013 01:31PM by InTheWind LOL Yorkiemom :)  That's something I would do to "Yay a nipple :)" thing.  I have to stop smoking or they won't let me do the skin from my belly.  So I'm trying to so I have more options. It seems skin from the belly works best for the most natural results and I don't like the idea of the expander as one lady I know says it's very uncomfortable.  I'm going to go for the implants because even though they are harder then normal breast or tissue transfers it seems less complicated.  I don't have another appointment with my surgeon scheduled yet so I don't know what page he is on with it all.  I just emailed him my prefrences and will see what is possible for my case when he gets back to me. I have been eatting so much these past two weeks that I have enough skin on my belly to make 3 boobs :) Brandon says I can only get two though :(
Posts.Title: Stage and grade of cancer determined AFTER surgery. What!?! InTheWind InTheWind

Posts.Content: Jan 9, 2013 01:00PM InTheWind wrote: That is a relief YorkieMom!!  I think I made the mistake of googling the photos to see and I've had people tell me their friend or relatives turned out bad but I have also heard that it turned out well for some too.  Is it a crap shoot? Or does it depend on the doctor? Or how much of everything has to be removed?  I'm so sorry if I offended someone who has had the reconstruction done.  It's just google results with nipple and skin sparring looked great and the ones where everything was taken (again google results) are scarry. I just don't know what to expect and I'm probably jumping the gun until I can talk to my surgeon and not just his nurse.
Posts.Title: Stage and grade of cancer determined AFTER surgery. What!?! InTheWind InTheWind

Posts.Content: Jan 14, 2013 07:54PM InTheWind wrote: Mary - how come you didn't do the reconstruction? Wasn't it an option? The MRI results came back today, but I still don't know much. Just that it is larger then the ultrasound measured.  The Ultra sound said 1.8 cm - the MRI says 3.1 plus three smaller ones in the same right and the left is about the same as the us picked up 1.3cm.  I meet with the surgon and oncologist the 16th.
Posts.Title: Stage and grade of cancer determined AFTER surgery. What!?! InTheWind InTheWind

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2013 01:10PM InTheWind wrote: Lily from everything I read it would be abnormal not to have the ILC in both breast.  I already know I do have it in both but if it was in only one I'd go ahead and get them both removed.  ((HUG)) You are stronger then me sister!  For the "elders' of the group (elder not in age but further along in the path) how did you get past the feelings like what I was afraid of and what Lily is going through?  How did you feel normal again?
Posts.Title: Stage and grade of cancer determined AFTER surgery. What!?! InTheWind InTheWind

Posts.Content: Jan 25, 2013 06:36AM InTheWind wrote: My lymph node biopsy surgery was cancelled until they do an ultrasound of my heart.  Turns out I have heart issues in addition to cancer.  Funny thing is I was perfectly healthy until I went to the doctors :)

Posts.Title: Stage and grade of cancer determined AFTER surgery. What!?! InTheWind InTheWind

Posts.Content: Jan 16, 2013 05:20PM - edited Jan 16, 2013 05:27PM by InTheWind Brandon and I went in to meet with the surgeon and oncologist today.  The Dr. said he wanted to remove both breast with out reconstruction and start me on Chemo. The oncologist said she wanted to start me on the most aggressive chemo treatment.  Neither one of them know what stage my cancer is or if it is in my lymph nodes. Their decisions are based on "standards" and my "young" age and that it grows with estrogen and one is 3.1 cm.   I in a very nice way said HELL NO!!!  There is no way I am going to go through the nightmare of breast removal/no reconstruction/ and intense chemo and radiation when they don't even know what STAGE of cancer I'm in or wheither or not it is in my lymph nodes and/or if it has spread outside of my breast.  I can understand the extremes when and if the cancer turns out to be spreading but no friggen way am I going to let them turn me into a freak show for a "standard" form of treatment when they don't know what is going on IN ME!  I will do what I have to do to live but I have no faith in these people when they want the extreme and this could turn out to be a low grade cancer confined only to my breast in which case removel and immediate reconstruction can be done.  They do NOT see a whole person and worse they don't even know the whole cancer story that is playing out inside of me and want to bring out the big guns.  Am I wrong??? I made them run more test and will not let them touch me until I have all the information so I can determine the treatment that will kill this cancer, keep me alive, and maintain my life as one big WHOLE.  So I did the P.E.T. Scan right after meeting with them and then if neccesary will do a lymph node biopsy BEFORE any surgery or treatment is determined.  The doctor wanted to do a lymph node biopsy before even running the PET Scan and lucky Brandon caught on to that right away and asked why he was putting the cart before the horse. So PET was done and when the results come in Brandon and I will go from there on our choices.  Extremnist that go in with little knowledge of the case at hand are not good in any line of work...uuuugggghhhh  They had an intern in the office with them. The same intern for both doctors. Congradulations they impressed their intern with their extrem treatment wants but the sure as shit didn't impress me when they couldn't even tell me if it was really neccesarry for MY case!
Posts.Title: Stage and grade of cancer determined AFTER surgery. What!?! InTheWind InTheWind

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2013 11:58AM InTheWind wrote: Oh and thank you everyone!!! I might not have replied to every post but I read every one and googled to get more info and followed your leads for more information! It was because of all of you that I didn't accept the treatment they wanted to do without first them gathering more information so I could make an informed choice!  I owe you all big time!!!  And when the doctor congradualted me on my knowledge - it came from you and from my offline friends and of course Brandon who was googling and sharing what he learned with me and him for standing up and questioning the doctors as well.  Love you all!!!!

Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2013 02:39PM InTheWind wrote: Hi kjiberty. I have had no luck getting a response from my doctor. I have been trying to reach him for several days to find out what he means and why the delay etc. So I finally sent him the following email.  I really don't know what to do. I can only goto Kiaser because of my insurance.  I want to change doctors but I also just want this to get done and over with. To: PHILIP NEFF, MD From: Michelle Skolyak Sent: 2/11/2013 12:23 PM MST Hi Dr, Neff. How long would the delay in reconstruction be if no cancer is found in my lymph nodes? I need to know what is going to happen on the 21st so if the mastectomy is going to be done without reconstruction I need to find where they sell the bra inserts. And if the reconstruction delay will be a long time even though there is no cancer found in the lymph nodes I need the information to decide how to proceed. Also, I need the research information on this type of cancer as far as the likeliness of spread if chemo is not done. If it hold a high chance then I would like to go ahead and get the mastectomy done the 21st and start the chemo shortly there after so I can get past this year as quickly as possible. When they called me and told me they found cancer and gave me the name of it she flat out told me to google it. I know several people who had breast cancer and none of them had to fight to get information from their doctors. I don't understand a lot of stuff in this case. This may be just another day to everyone at Kiaser as you have many cancer patients but you all need to understand this is new and very serious to me. I feel like Brandon and I are alone out here fighting this cancer and not getting help, information, or any support from Kiaser.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2013 12:32AM InTheWind wrote: Knowing what chemo does to us would you elect to not have it if your cancer was currently only in your breasts? I have ILC and it's in both breast. The doctor doesn't know the stage yet but based on google I'm a stage IIa. The doctor wants to cut off both breast with no reconstruction, radiation, and "the most aggressive chemo treatment available"  So no boobs, no hair, eyelashed or eyebrows for about a year.  I'm searously leaning towards telling him NO because I don't want to be treated for something that could or could not happen (that the cancer shows up again in a diffrent part of my body) but I wonder if my vanity is causeing me to risk an early death.  To boot I got some kind of heart problem (left bundle branch block) and had to cancel my lymph node biopsy suregery and do a heart ultra sound.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2013 05:31PM InTheWind wrote: Dr. Neff didn't tell me to google. I just realized it sounded that way. It was a nurse that was calling me back with test results from my biopsy.  I got a call back today from Dr. Neff's nurse. She had breast cancer 12 years ago. She was awesome to talk to!  She got my surgery scheduled for the 18th. They will remove both and test the lymph nodes that same day.  After talking to the nurse with experience I decided to go ahead and do the chemo and thus there will be a delay in reconstruction. Dr. Neff is crappy at getting me information that I need. I think when I need advice or information I will call the nurse with experience.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53
